etymologies: Middle English: from Old French joigneor, from joindre ‘to join’

definitions: a person who constructs the wooden components of a building, such as stairs, doors, and door and window frames

examples.text: bricklayers and joiners are needed to convert derelict properties

shortDefinitions: person who constructs wooden components of building, such as stairs

definitions: a person who readily joins groups or campaigns

examples.text: a compulsive joiner of revolutionary movements

shortDefinitions: person who readily joins groups or campaigns
